column4: Apple allows long-term shareholders to nominate board members
column5: Dec 23 Apple Inc on Tuesday became the latest U.S. company to amend its bylaws to allow long-term shareholders to nominate members to its board.

column4: RPT-New boss in dash for simplicity at bloated Rolls-Royce
column5: FILTON  England  Dec 22 Twelve months and 80 signatures: that is what it recently took Rolls-Royce to approve a small change requested by a supplier  symptomatic of a business that had become as complex as the engines it makes to power the world's biggest jets.

column4: Creditor banks to inject 113 mln euros into Abengoa - sources
column5: MADRID  Dec 23 Creditor banks of Spanish energy and engineering firm Abengoa have agreed to inject 113 million euros ($123 million) into the debt-laden company  two sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: Bed Bath & Beyond narrows profit forecast  shares fall
column5: Home furnishings retailer Bed Bath & Beyond  slashed its third-quarter profit forecast  the latest retailer to do so in a sluggish U.S. retail market.

column4: Bed Bath & Beyond narrows profit forecast  shares fall
column5: Dec 22 Home furnishings retailer Bed Bath & Beyond slashed its third-quarter profit forecast  the latest retailer to do so in a sluggish U.S. retail market.

column4: Express Scripts in talks over new Anthem contract  forecasts growth
column5: Pharmacy benefit manager Express Scripts Holding Co said it was negotiating the repricing of its contract with Anthem Inc  one of its biggest customers  but it was too soon to know the financial terms of the deal.

column4: Kamada's rabies drug succeeds in trial
column5: Israeli drugmaker Kamada Ltd said its rabies therapy was found as effective as a reference drug in a large trial and it would file for a U.S. approval for the therapy by mid-2016.

column4: UPDATE 1-Kamada's rabies drug succeeds in trial
column5: Dec 23 Israeli drugmaker Kamada Ltd   said its rabies therapy was found as effective as a reference drug in a large trial and it would file for a U.S. approval for the therapy by mid-2016.

column4: Kamada's rabies drug succeeds in trial
column5: Dec 23 Drugmaker Kamada Ltd said its rabies therapy had met the main goal in a large study  where it was found to be non-inferior to a reference product.

column4: LKQ to buy Italy's Rhiag to boost Europe auto spares business
column5: U.S.-based LKQ Corp  said it would buy Italy's Rhiag-Inter Auto Parts Italia SpA  owned by private equity firm Apax Partners LLP  to expand in the European auto spares market.

column4: Nexstar in talks to buy Media General for around $17.50/shr -sources
column5: Nexstar Broadcasting Group  is in talks to buy Media General  for around $17.50 per share in a more than $2 billion deal that would create the second largest U.S. local television broadcaster  according to two sources familiar with the situation.

column4: UPDATE 1-Nexstar in talks to buy Media General for around $17.50/shr -sources

column4: Exclusive - Nexstar in talks to buy Media General for around $17.50 per share: sources
column5: Nexstar Broadcasting Group  is in talks to buy Media General  for around $17.50 per share in a deal that would be valued at over $2 billion  according to two sources familiar with the situation.

column4: European Factors to Watch-Equity futures rise
column5: LONDON  Dec 23 European equity futures rose on Wednesday  buoyed by gains on Asian and U.S. equity markets.

column4: European Factors to Watch-Shares seen higher at open
column5: LONDON  Dec 23 European stocks were seen opening higher on Wednesday  tracking gains on Asian and U.S. equity markets.

column5: * Sanofi has submitted Lixilan for regulatory review in the US  triggering a $20 million milestone payment

column4: HK pips New York as world's biggest IPO capital  2016 outlook strong
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 23 Hong Kong replaced New York this year as the world's biggest IPO market by the amount of funds raised  buoyed by Chinese banks and other financial firms  with the deal pipeline pointing to a stronger year ahead.

column4: SingPost to appoint special auditors to probe corporate governance issues
column5: SINGAPORE Singapore Post Ltd (SingPost) said on Wednesday it will appoint special auditors to investigate corporate governance issues raised by a shareholder  a day after the company said it had not disclosed a director's interest in a 2014 acquisition announcement.

column4: Lockheed-Boeing venture orders 20 more Russian rocket engines
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 23 United Launch Alliance  a joint venture of Lockheed Martin Corp and Boeing Co   on Wednesday said it ordered 20 additional RD-180 rocket engines from Russia  on top of 29 engines still being delivered.

column4: Pentagon eyes proposal for M&A changes in 'weeks'
column5: WASHINGTON The Pentagon and other U.S. government agencies should complete a legislative proposal in coming weeks to let regulators block proposed mergers for national security reasons  instead of just antitrust concerns  a top official said on Tuesday.

column4: Brazil's Braskem  Petrobras sign five-year naphtha supply contract
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 23 Brazil's state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA agreed on Wednesday to sign a naphtha supply contract with Braskem SA  Latin America's largest petrochemical producer  for five years.

column4: New blood thinner 'antidote' to help doctors move past warfarin
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 23 A new class of blood thinners that competes with widely used warfarin should get a boost next year when an "antidote" that can reverse the medications' effects in an emergency is expected to enter the market  according to top U.S. heart doctors and investors.

column4: China Southern says to buy Airbus aircraft for $2.3 billion
column5: BEIJING China Southern Airlines Co  has signed deals worth about $2.3 billion to buy 10 aircrafts from Airbus Group SE <AIR .PA>  the carrier said on Wednesday.

column4: China Southern says to buy Airbus aircraft for $2.3 billion
column5: BEIJING  Dec 23 China Southern Airlines Co  has signed deals worth about $2.3 billion to buy 10 aircrafts from Airbus Group SE  the carrier said on Wednesday.

column4: CORRECTED-SPECIAL REPORT-Money-go-round fuels buybacks  leaves workers sidelined
column5: WATERLOO  Iowa  Dec 23 Matt Happel and Pam Egli are first cousins  part of a sprawling family so big it rents a church hall for Christmas parties.

column4: CORRECTED-MOVES - UBS hires equity capital markets banker from Deutsche
column5: Dec 23 UBS has hired Jeff Mortara from Deutsche Bank AG as a managing director and the head of financial institutions and East Coast technology equity capital markets  according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

column4: Enterprise Products secures first crude oil export contract
column5: Dec 23 Enterprise Products Partners LP  said it won its first contract to export U.S crude  days after the U.S. Congress voted to lift a four-decade ban on oil exports.

column4: Top two Ferrari investors sign pact over 48.8 percent of voting rights
column5: MILAN The top two investors in Ferrari  have signed a shareholder pact giving them a total voting power of nearly 50 percent to keep firm grip on the sports car maker after it separates from Fiat Chrysler Automobiles .

column4: Freeport-McMoRan to launch auction for oil and gas assets-sources
column5: Dec 23 Freeport-McMoRan Inc  the U.S. miner that was targeted by activist investor Carl Icahn earlier this year  is planning to run an auction process for its oil and gas assets in early 2016  according to people familiar with the matter.

column5: Dec 23 Hyatt Hotels Corp on Wednesday asked customers to review payment card statements for possible fraud after it found malicious software in its payment processing systems for hotels it manages.

column4: Hyatt finds malware at payment processing systems
column5: Dec 23 Hotel operator Hyatt Hotels Corp  said it had identified malware on computers that operate the payment processing systems for Hyatt-managed locations.

column4: Kentucky reaches $39.5 million settlement with Purdue  Johnson & Johnson
column5: Kentucky reached two separate settlements totaling $39.5 million with Purdue Pharma and Johnson & Johnson  Attorney General Jack Conway said on Wednesday.

column4: Juniper breach reflects risk of 'back doors': researchers
column5: WASHINGTON A Juniper Networks Inc software coding vulnerability disclosed last week shows the dangers of any weaknesses built into encryption technology  according to computer security experts.

column4: Ex-Morgan Stanley adviser spared U.S. prison term for taking data
column5: A former Morgan Stanley financial adviser was spared prison on Tuesday for illegally accessing the bank's computers and taking home client data that his lawyers say Russian hackers then obtained and posted online.

column4: Nike's futures orders surge as demand in China  North America soars
column5: Nike Inc   the world's largest footwear maker  reported futures orders that breezed past analysts' estimates  powered by strong demand in North America and China.

column4: UPDATE 1-Norfolk Southern rejects Canadian Pacific's revised offer
column5: Dec 23 U.S. railroad operator Norfolk Southern Corp rejected Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd's  revised bid  reiterating that it was "grossly inadequate" and created "substantial regulatory risks and uncertainties".

column4: Brazil regulator sets rules for Petrobras oil fields rights renewal
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras will have to agree to extract at least 900 million barrels more of oil and natural gas equivalent from its Marlim and Voador offshore oil fields to win early renewal of its concession rights  oil regulator ANP said.

column4: Pfizer defeats NYU claim for cancer drug royalties
column5: Pfizer Inc does not owe New York University any royalties on the lung cancer drug Xalkori  a New York state judge ruled in an opinion issued Friday.

column5: * Advocate General says EU tobacco law is valid  proportionate

column4: Adviser to top EU court says EU cigarette law is valid
column5: LUXEMBOURG An adviser to Europe's highest court in Luxembourg on Wednesday said an EU law on cigarettes was valid  rebuffing a challenge from Philip Morris International  although the court still has to deliver a final ruling.

column4: Pentagon vows tough scrutiny of Raytheon GPS control system
column5: WASHINGTON The Pentagon's chief arms buyer on Tuesday vowed "very intense management" of Raytheon Co's work on a ground control network for new global positioning system (GPS) satellites  and said the department would revisit other options if Raytheon's performance did not improve.

column4: France's Total eyes fuel stations in Angola  signs MOU
column5: LUANDA  Dec 23 France's Total has signed an memorandum of understanding with Angola's Sonangol  a first step to opening fuel stations in the southern African nation  Total told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Polish ING unit may get 42 mln euros thanks to Visa deal
column5: WARSAW  Dec 23 Polish lender ING Bank Slaski  may get 31 million euros  ($33.81 million) in cash and a further nearly 11 million euros in shares thanks to a settlement of the takeover transaction of Visa Europe by Visa Inc  the bank said.

column4: Wal-Mart considers closing 5 percent of Brazil stores: report
column5: SAO PAULO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  is considering closing about 30 stores and renting some of its property in Brazil next year  Brazilian newspaper Valor Econômico reported on Wednesday  as the world's largest retailer looks to exit poor-performing markets.
